title: Hemiplegic Upper Limb Impairment Observation and Kinematic Assessment Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners are physical therapy students or job seekers in related fields, cultivating hemiplegic upper limb assessment skills through formative practical evaluations in a smartphone-based limited technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can observe and evaluate speed, path indirectness, and jerkiness during hemiplegic upper limb movement tasks with 80% accuracy.
Learners reduce kinematic assessment errors by over 30% through Knowledge Results (KR) feedback training.
Learners maintain training effectiveness and demonstrate consistent observational skills in evaluations conducted one week later.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
